Buying US Stocks Monthly
Buying stocks monthly has been gaining popularity in recent years. This is a good strategy because investors can benefit from dollar-cost average. Saving and investing monthly is a good way to start investing – it becomes habit forming. When the investor dollar-cost averages, he/she invests an equal amount in the market monthly. Instead of trying to time the market, the investor buys in at a range of different price points, as opposed to investing a large lump sum all at one time. However, not all platforms accept buying US stocks monthly. Now, in Hong Kong, only a few platforms including uSmart and CHIEF Group allow investors to buy stocks monthly.
US Stocks Trading Hours
Summer Time (Mar- Nov)

Winter Time (Nov- Mar)
10:30 pm - 5 am Hong Kong Time Monday to Friday
Benefits of Hong Kong People Investing in the US Stocks Market
Wide Range of World-Renowned Stocks
There are a wide range of world-renowned companies in the US stock markets including Apple, Google, Amazon for investors to choose from.
Lower Investment Threshold
In the Hong Kong stock market, investors are required to buy at least “one lot” of the stock, which may be equivalent to 100 shares, 500 shares, etc., depending upon the stock price. However, in the US stocks market, investors can buy only ‘one share’, which lowers the investment threshold significantly.
Disadvantages of Investing in the US Stocks Market while living in Hong Kong
Time difference The US stock market, like any other markets, runs on the local time. Therefore, it could be difficult for Hong Kong investors to monitor the stock movement due to the difference in time zone.
Buying US Stocks in Hong Kong FAQ
Do I have to pay US stocks tax if I am not a US citizen and are buying in HK?
No, you do not have to. Non-US citizens and residents with no US business are typically not obligated to file a U.S. tax return. However, investors are required to pay tax on dividends. But it will be automatically deducted before transferring to your account.
Is it safe to invest through a US Stocks broker in Hong Kong?
Yes it is. Regulated brokerage accounts are insured by SPIC for a maximum coverage of UDS$500,000.
Can I create a US stock trading account in Hong Kong as an expat?
Yes, as long as you are able to provide the required documents, you are eligible to open a US stock trading account. For example, in order to open an account in Sofi Hong Kong, you need to present the following documents:
a copy of your passport
proof of residential address
proof of a bank account in your name maintained with a licensed bank in Hong Kong
How to buy US stocks commission-free?
To enjoy zero commission, investors can trade on platforms like SoFi, uSmart, Charles Schwab,etc.
When does the US Stock market open?
The US Stock Market is open Monday- Friday from 9.30 am- 4pm US Time.
How much tax do I need to pay when I receive dividends?
It is normally 30%.
